intro: Coleospadix angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spadix plant, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their spadix and spathe structures. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, with a smooth surface and a distinct midrib. The inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe, which plays a role in attracting pollinators.
